lcInstruction.p: The sample files for Authoring DITA concept topics are in the zip file concept_samples.zip. Download this file to a location on your hard drive that you’ll remember, then extract the contents to a folder.
Inside the concept_samples.zip folder, you will find a folder for each of the first four lessons in this course:
In each lesson folder, you will find four DITA files:

li.p: l_(filename)_start.dita: The empty sample file you will populate as you follow along with each lesson.
l_(filename).dita: The completed version of the sample file you can use to check your work.
l_(filename)_exercise_start.dita: The empty file you will populate as you complete the exercise at the end of each lesson.
l_(filename)_exercise.dita: The completed version of the exercise file you can use to check your work.

lcInstruction.p: Each lesson will instruct you on which files to use for the samples and exercises.

Create a local copy of each file to work in as you complete the lessons. If you reach a point where your working file doesn’t match the examples, or is broken for any reason, you can make a fresh copy and resume your work or start over.
lcInstruction.ph: In the instructions and examples, we show you the DITA code for each sample file. Most DITA editors have auto-complete or other similar features to guide you through the process of adding elements, so you will probably not need to create every piece of code from scratch as you work. Our demo videos were created in oXygen XML Editor and show the differences between working in author view and working with the code in text view.
